newsitem.title: GERMANY: WestLB expects nine month '96 op profit up 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: WestLB expects nine month '96 op profit up 10 pct.

text.p: Management board chairman of Westdeutsche Landesbank Girozentrale Friedel Neuber expects operating profit in the first nine months of 1996, after risk provisions, to rise 10 percent.
Neuber said profits in full-year 1996 would stay around 1995 levels.
"We will hold 1996 profit levels at 1995 levels," Neuber told journalists in Frankfurt.
In 1995, WestLB reported an operating profit, before risk provisions, of 1.829 billion marks, with net profits of 520 million marks.
